Posts.Content: I'm sorry you are having so much pain and unable to take something for it. I don't believe I have high tolerance for pain as I had a good size sliver removed from my thigh and once the numbness wore off it was like my leg had been cut off. Also 14 months ago I had a full hip replacement and it is just starting to settle in and not hurt. Also had fluid drained from my knee just before we left on this trip. The PA said "bee sting". It was more like a snake bite. I give my surgeon full credit for his skills and gentleness. Never has hurt me even as he did 5 aspirations. If I ever need surgery again, I'll make an appointment to see him.
Posts.Title: No Pain Mastectomy

Posts.Content: I had a MRM and 11 lymph nodes removed 4 weeks ago and have never had pain.  1 sentinel node had cancer cells, the reason for the other 10 removal which were clean.  No reconstuction for me, I'm 79.  No pain with the dye injection - totally pain free.  Puzzles me.  I had drain tubes for 7 days and no pain when they were removed.  I have had 3 aspirations since the surgery, quite a large amount of fluid and believe this last one is the end.  Has anyone else experienced being cut from sternum to under the arm, flesh removed and not felt pain.  Never took medication for this surgery.  I have felt great since the removal of the breast.
Posts.Title: No Pain Mastectomy

Posts.Content: I'm very happy for you and feel badly for those who suffer daily from pain. My pain level in nothing above average as I had full hip replacement 15 months ago and the soreness is finally diminishing. Didn't think it would ever heal. Prayers for all of those who are struggling to fight this disease and hopefully we shall all Heal and overcome.
Posts.Title: No Pain Mastectomy

Posts.Content: I'm the person who reported here last year about having a pain free mastectomy plus 11 lymph nodes removed - one node was cancer positive. Started on Arimidex in September 2014 and had a few puny days, but over that now. I've also had 2 injection of Prolevia, the first one in my arm which stay quite sore for sometime. Received the 2nd. injection in my stomach which was much better - no soreness at all. The reason for this update is to let everyone know that after going through cancer surgery, I had a mini stroke in April of this year. When I arrived at the ER my blood pressure was 225/110. I've never have had high blood pressure but it stay very high for about a week while in the hospital. I spent one week in the hospital plus 1 week in a rehab facility. Once home I spent 6 weeks in outpatient OT & PT. I'm still not 100% and probably never will be. Left side weakness and fatigue. I need a knee replacement but ortho Dr. will not do it until I gain some strength. I'm 80 now so gaining strength isn't likely in as much as I'm not able to get around well without a walker. I suggested to the ER Physician that Arimidex had caused my stroke and his comment was, "Arimidex is blamed for most problems people have when taking it". So curious if others have had a stroke while taking Arimidex? Best to all who are fight their own battle with cancer.
Posts.Title: Follow Up of 7-22-14 Mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi April: I'm very surprised as I was offered a bilateral with my mastsectomy in July. I chose not to go with it but thought Medicare coved it. I'm 79 so I don't believe it has to do with age. Did you check it out in your Medicare Guide? Good luck.
Posts.Title: Medicare coverage denied for bilateral mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hello. I had a mastectomy last July and I'm now taking Arimidex. I've had no Chemo or Radiation. 11 lymph nodes were remove, one with cancer. The surgery was painless and Arimidex only made me feel sick a few days after I started taking it. In April of this year I had a mini stroke. Spent 1 week in hospital and 1 week in rehab. I still have a very week left arm and when I get tired my left food wants to drag. I'm now 80 yo and wondering if others with breast cancer has also suffered a stroke?
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer and Stroke

Posts.Content: Started the Arimidex 11 days ago and so far so good. No noticable side effects. As my doctor said, " You will never know unless you try it". I hope I continue to do fell well and this is the answer for me to beat this disease. I'm very sorry so many of you feel so terrible taking Arimidex (Anastrozole). I just wish everyone could feel as well as I do. It puzzles me that the med does so much damage to one's body such as it can burn your skin. What might it be doing to my stomach! We'll know in time.
Posts.Title: Arimidex Update

Posts.Content: On Oct 31, 2014 4:12 PM amyOK wrote: Hello! I know how you feel about the abnormal cervical cells. Did you know that paps have a 30% false negative rate? Also the virus that causes those abnormal cells (which may or may not develop into cancer- most don't). I know about this stuff because 20 years ago my stepfather did a cdc study that eventually led to the discovery that this virus (HPV) causes abnormal "pre-cancerous" (I put that in italics b/c in most people it never does develop into cancer, so breathe a little sigh of relief and demand a colposcopy at least every 6 months. I waited 3 months after my husband found my lump too actually go to my GYN, who told me to get a mammogram. I dragged my feet on that too because I was AFRAID of getting a mammogram (the pain not the results). Get it checked out. It doesn't hurt that much. Also my doctors told me many, many times that they're finding breast cancer is not necessarily genetic. No one in my family has ever had it and I was 43 when I had it. Granted it's only been 7 months since my diagnosis but they got the whole tumor no lymph node involved and then I had radiation and now I feel great! I'm happier than I have ever been. My tumor was "typed" and it showed a very low risk of recurrence. I feel like I beat death. Good luck to you. It doesn't have to be so scary. Hello Amy: I know you are scared having found a lump in your breast. Please get it checked as soon as possible.  I too found a small lump in my breast the end of June, 2014.  I asked my husband if I should wait a couple of months before seeing my GP as I thought the lump would go away or it was a cyst.  He insisted I go to the doctor the next morning.  My doctor said it was "probably nothing just a thicking of breast tissue" but he told me I should have a mamogram. I did and because of the lump they also did an ultrasound.   The radiation doctor said my exam didn't look good and in 2 days I had the biopsy.  Cancer!  Within three weeks I had a mastsectomy as 1 lymph node also had cancer cells. The mastsectory was my choice as I am 79 and at my age did not breast cancer.  All has gone very well for me - Core Biopsy (didn't hurt and no pain after).  In fact the next day we drove 600+ miles to visit with out family for the holiday weekend. I've had a Mastsectomy, Anastrozole 1 mg cancer medication, and the Prolia injection (10 days of feeling puny days 10 days after the injection).  I have never had pain, sickness or sore muscles as some have experienced. Perhaps I'm one of the luck ones, but looking forward to the rest of my cancer free life.  Please get your mamogram and let them know you have a lump as they should then do an ultrasound.  Good luck to you and be save rather than sorry later.
Posts.Title: Lump in my breast

Posts.Content: Hi: I started on Anastrozole, a form of Arimidex in Sept. So far I've had no side effects either other than a few face flushes whice lasted for about 1 month. I have had a very easy recovery from stage 2 EP BREAST cancer surgery. So, don't think the Arimidex is not working. My doctor told me that very few people have side effects from the little white pill. People usually only write the bad results as they do with any other type of drug. Good luck and hang in there.
Posts.Title: Arimidex..may not be working

Posts.Content: Why do you say Arimidex not not be working after 7 years. Has your Cancer returned? I'm doing very well with Arimidex. I've had a few days of "puny" feelings, but nothing to worry about. I've lost 20+ pounds but have also stopped eating most sweets. It's been over 6 months since my mastectomy. Glad you have felt well through all of the trying times.
Posts.Title: Arimidex..may not be working

Posts.Content: Why do you say Arimidex not not be working after 7 years. Has your Cancer returned? I'm doing very well with Arimidex. I've had a few days of "puny" feelings, but nothing to worry about. I've lost 20+ pounds but have also stopped eating most sweets. It's been over 6 months since my mastectomy. Glad you have felt well through all of the trying times.
Posts.Title: Arimidex..may not be working

Posts.Content: Hi Jan: Gosh, that seems like a very long time for drains. Mine were in for 5 days but then I had asperation 5 times after about week apart. The first 90 days after surgery is included in the doctors surgery fee, so maybe he doesn't care to bear the expense of asperation. I didn't have radition or chemo - just taking Anastrozole every day and Prolia injection twice a year. Good luck.
Posts.Title: drains, agggh
